title: Add WASD and arrow key controls to all games

requirements.text: Update SnakeGame to accept both WASD keys (W=up, A=left, S=down, D=right) and arrow keys for directional movement, allowing both control schemes to work simultaneously

quotes: ok all the games shoud be able to use wasd and arrows to move

acceptanceCriteria: Snake responds to W key for up movement
Snake responds to A key for left movement
Snake responds to S key for down movement
Snake responds to D key for right movement
Snake continues to respond to all arrow keys
Both WASD and arrow keys can be used interchangeably during gameplay

requirements.text: Update PongGame to accept both WASD keys (W=up, S=down) and arrow keys (ArrowUp, ArrowDown) for paddle movement, allowing both control schemes to work simultaneously

quotes: ok all the games shoud be able to use wasd and arrows to move

acceptanceCriteria: Pong paddle responds to W key for upward movement
Pong paddle responds to S key for downward movement
Pong paddle continues to respond to arrow up and arrow down keys
Both WASD and arrow keys can be used interchangeably during gameplay

requirements.text: Update BreakoutGame to accept both WASD keys (A=left, D=right) and arrow keys (ArrowLeft, ArrowRight) for paddle movement, allowing both control schemes to work simultaneously

quotes: ok all the games shoud be able to use wasd and arrows to move

acceptanceCriteria: Breakout paddle responds to A key for left movement
Breakout paddle responds to D key for right movement
Breakout paddle continues to respond to arrow left and arrow right keys
Both WASD and arrow keys can be used interchangeably during gameplay

requirements.text: Update the GameControlsOverlay component to display both WASD and arrow key controls for each game in the controls dialog

quotes: ok all the games shoud be able to use wasd and arrows to move

acceptanceCriteria: Controls overlay shows WASD keys alongside arrow keys for Snake
Controls overlay shows WASD keys alongside arrow keys for Pong
Controls overlay shows WASD keys alongside arrow keys for Breakout
Display format clearly indicates both control schemes are available

constraints: Both WASD and arrow keys must work simultaneously without requiring mode switching
Existing arrow key controls must continue to function exactly as before
nonGoals: Customizable key bindings or control remapping
Adding additional control schemes beyond WASD and arrows
